cards.name: Air Elemental
cards.text: Flying
cards.originalText: Flying
cards.flavor: These spirits of the air are winsome and wild and cannot be truly contained. Only marginally intelligent, they often substitute whimsy for strategy, delighting in mischief and mayhem.

cards.name: Ancestral Recall
cards.text: Target player draws three cards.
cards.originalText: Draw 3 cards or force opponent to draw 3 cards.

cards.name: Animate Artifact
cards.text:
Enchant artifact

As long as enchanted artifact isn't a creature, it's an artifact creature with power and toughness each equal to its converted mana cost.
cards.originalText: Target artifact is now a creature with both power and toughness equal to its casting cost; target retains all its original abilities as well. This will destroy artifacts with 0 casting cost.

rulings.text: This card has been returned to its original functionality. If it is enchanting an artifact that's already a creature, it won't change its power and toughness.

A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature can attack, and its {T} abilities can be activated, only if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of his or her most recent turn. It doesn't matter how long the permanent has been a creature.

cards.name: Animate Dead
cards.text:
Enchant creature card in a graveyard

When Animate Dead enters the battlefield, if it's on the battlefield, it loses "enchant creature card in a graveyard" and gains "enchant creature put onto the battlefield with Animate Dead." Return enchanted creature card to the battlefield under your control and attach Animate Dead to it. When Animate Dead leaves the battlefield, that creature's controller sacrifices it.

Enchanted creature gets -1/-0.
cards.originalText: Any creature in either player's graveyard comes into play on your side with -1 to its original power. If this enchantment is removed, or at end of game, target creature is returned to its owner's graveyard. Target creature may be killed as normal.

rulings.text: When putting a card onto the battlefield that requires a definition for its value or some other choice, you do what is needed to define the value or make the choice.

This is a new wording. Animate Dead is now an Aura. You target a creature card in a graveyard when you cast it. It enters the battlefield attached to that card. Then it returns that card to the battlefield, and attaches itself to that card again (since the card is treated as a new object on the battlefield).

Once the creature is returned to the battlefield, Animate Dead can't be attached to anything other than it (unless Animate Dead somehow manages to put a different creature onto the battlefield). Attempting to move Animate Dead to another creature won't work.

If the creature card put onto the battlefield has Protection from Black (or anything that prevents this from legally being attached), this won't be able to attach to it. Then this will go to the graveyard as a State-Based Action, causing the creature to be sacrificed.
A "creature card" is any card with the type Creature, even if it has other types such as Artifact, Enchantment, or Land. Older cards of type Summon are also Creature cards.

cards.name: Animate Wall
cards.text:
Enchant Wall

Enchanted Wall can attack as though it didn't have defender.
cards.originalText: Target wall can now attack. Target wall's power and toughness are unchanged, even if its power is 0.

rulings.text: This is a change from the most recent wording. As was the case in the past, Animate Wall can now enchant only a Wall.

cards.name: Ankh of Mishra
cards.text: Whenever a land enters the battlefield, Ankh of Mishra deals 2 damage to that land's controller.
cards.originalText: Ankh does 2 damage to anyone who puts a new land into play.

rulings.text: This triggers on any land entering the battlefield. This includes playing a land or putting a land onto the battlefield using a spell or ability.
It determines the land's controller at the time the ability resolves. If the land leaves the battlefield before the ability resolves, the land's last controller before it left is used.

cards.name: Armageddon
cards.text: Destroy all lands.
cards.originalText: All lands in play are destroyed.

cards.name: Aspect of Wolf
cards.text:
Enchant creature

Enchanted creature gets +X/+Y, where X is half the number of Forests you control, rounded down, and Y is half the number of Forests you control, rounded up.
cards.originalText: Target creature's power and toughness are increased by half the number of forests you have in play, rounding down for power and up for toughness.

rulings.text: The effect is continuously updated based on the number of Forests you control at any given time.

cards.name: Bad Moon
cards.text: Black creatures get +1/+1.
cards.originalText: All black creatures in play gain +1/+1.

cards.name: Badlands
cards.originalText: Counts as both mountains and swamp and is affected by spells that affect either. Tap to add either {R} or {B} to your mana pool.

rulings.text: Land type changing effects that change a dual land's land type will remove the old land types completely. Text-changing effects that just change one of the two land types will leave the other type unaffected.
This card is a Mountain and a Swamp even while in the graveyard, library, or any other zone.
This has the mana abilities associated with both of its basic land types.
This has basic land types, but it isn't a basic land. Things that affect basic lands don't affect it. Things that affect basic land types do.

cards.name: Balance
cards.text: Each player chooses a number of lands he or she controls equal to the number of lands controlled by the player who controls the fewest, then sacrifices the rest. Players discard cards and sacrifice creatures the same way.
cards.originalText: Whichever player has more lands in play must discard enough lands of his or her choice to equalize the number of lands both players have in play. Cards in hand and creatures in play must be equalized the same way. Creatures lost in this manner may not be regenerated.

rulings.text: This spell is not targeted, so cards which can't be targeted, such as a creature with Protection from White, are both counted and valid choices for being sacrificed.
All cards sacrificed at one time go to the graveyard simultaneously. All cards discarded go to the graveyard simultaneously. As always, you pick the order they end up in the graveyard.
Cards are not counted until the appropriate step. So, a land creature sacrificed to the first part of the spell would not count for the last part.

cards.name: Basalt Monolith
cards.text:
Basalt Monolith doesn't untap during your untap step.

{T}: Add {3} to your mana pool.

{3}: Untap Basalt Monolith.
cards.originalText: Tap to add 3 colorless mana to your mana pool. Does not untap as normal during untap phase; spend {3} to untap. Tapping this artifact can be played as an interrupt.

rulings.text: It can be untapped as often as you can pay for it.

cards.name: Bayou
cards.originalText: Counts as both swamp and forest and is affected by spells that affect either. Tap to add either {B} or {G} to your mana pool.

rulings.text: This has the mana abilities associated with both of its basic land types.
This has basic land types, but it isn't a basic land. Things that affect basic lands don't affect it. Things that affect basic land types do.

cards.name: Benalish Hero
cards.text: Banding (Any creatures with banding, and up to one without, can attack in a band. Bands are blocked as a group. If any creatures with banding you control are blocking or being blocked by a creature, you divide that creature's combat damage, not its controller, among any of the creatures it's being blocked by or is blocking.)
cards.originalText: Bands
cards.flavor: Benalia has a complex caste system that changes with the lunar year. No matter what the season, the only caste that cannot be attained by either heredity or money is that of the hero.

rulings.text: If a creature with banding attacks, it can team up with any number of other attacking creatures with banding (and up to one nonbanding creature) and attack as a unit called a "band." The band can be blocked by any creature that could block a single creature in the band. Blocking any creature in a band blocks the entire band. If a creature with banding is blocked, the attacking player chooses how the blockers' damage is assigned.
A maximum of one nonbanding creature can join an attacking band no matter how many creatures with banding are in it.
Creatures in the same band must all attack the same player or planeswalker.
If a creature in combat has banding, its controller assigns damage for creatures blocking or blocked by it. That player can ignore the damage assignment order when making this assignment.

cards.name: Berserk
cards.text:
Cast Berserk only before the combat damage step.

Target creature gains trample and gets +X/+0 until end of turn, where X is its power. At the beginning of the next end step, destroy that creature if it attacked this turn.
cards.originalText: Until end of turn, target creature's current power doubles and it gains trample ability. If it attacks, target creature is destroyed at end of turn. This spell cannot be cast after current turn's attack is completed.

rulings.text: If the permanent stops being a creature before the end of the turn, it is still destroyed.

cards.name: Birds of Paradise
cards.text:
Flying

{T}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.
cards.originalText:
Flying

Tap to add one mana of any color to your mana pool. This tap may be played as an interrupt.

cards.name: Black Knight
cards.text:
First strike (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)

Protection from white (This creature can't be blocked, targeted, dealt damage, or enchanted by anything white.)
cards.originalText: Protection from white, first strike
cards.flavor: Battle doesn't need a purpose; the battle is its own purpose. You don't ask why a plague spreads or a field burns. Don't ask why I fight.

cards.name: Black Lotus
cards.text: {T}, Sacrifice Black Lotus: Add three mana of any one color to your mana pool.
cards.originalText: Adds 3 mana of any single color of your choice to your mana pool, then is discarded. Tapping this artifact can be played as an interrupt.

cards.name: Black Vise
cards.text:
As Black Vise enters the battlefield, choose an opponent.

At the beginning of the chosen player's upkeep, Black Vise deals X damage to that player, where X is the number of cards in his or her hand minus 4.
cards.originalText: If opponent has more than four cards in hand during upkeep, black vise does 1 damage to opponent for each card in excess of four.

rulings.text: You choose one opposing player as it enters the battlefield and it only affects that one player. This choice is not changed even if Black Vise changes controllers. It becomes useless but stays on the battlefield if that player leaves the game.
If the chosen player has four or fewer cards in his or her hand as Black Vise's ability resolves, the ability just won't do anything that turn.

cards.name: Black Ward
cards.text:
Enchant creature

Enchanted creature has protection from black. This effect doesn't remove Black Ward.
cards.originalText: Target creature gains protection from black.

cards.name: Blaze of Glory
cards.text:
Cast Blaze of Glory only during combat before blockers are declared.

Target creature defending player controls can block any number of creatures this turn. It blocks each attacking creature this turn if able.
cards.originalText: Target defending creature can and must block all attacking creatures it can legally block. For example, a normal non-flying target defender can and must block all normal non-flying attackers at once, but it cannot block any flying attackers. Controller of target defender may distribute damage among attackers as desired. Play before defense is chosen.

rulings.text: Does not allow a tapped creature to block, or allow a creature to block any creatures it would not normally be able to block.
If a turn has multiple combat phases, this spell can be cast during any of them as long as it's before the beginning of that phase's Declare Blockers Step.

cards.name: Blessing
cards.text:
Enchant creature

{W}: Enchanted creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
cards.originalText: {W} Target creature gains +1/+1 until end of turn.

cards.name: Blue Elemental Blast
cards.text: Choose one — Counter target red spell; or destroy target red permanent.
cards.originalText: Counters a red spell being cast or destroys a red card in play.

rulings.text: The decision to counter a spell or destroy a permanent is a decision made on announcement before the target is selected. If the spell is redirected, this mode can't be changed, so only targets of the selected type are valid.

cards.name: Blue Ward
cards.text:
Enchant creature

Enchanted creature has protection from blue. This effect doesn't remove Blue Ward.
cards.originalText: Target creature gains protection from blue.

cards.name: Bog Wraith
cards.text: Swampwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Swamp.)
cards.originalText: Swampwalk
cards.flavor:
'Twas in the bogs of Cannelbrae 

My mate did meet an early grave

'Twas nothing left for us to save

In the peat-filled bogs of Cannelbrae.

cards.name: Braingeyser
cards.text: Target player draws X cards.
cards.originalText: Draw X cards or force opponent to draw X cards.

cards.name: Burrowing
cards.text:
Enchant creature

Enchanted creature has mountainwalk.
cards.originalText: Target creature gains mountainwalk.

cards.name: Camouflage
cards.text:
Cast Camouflage only during your declare attackers step.

This turn, instead of declaring blockers, each defending player chooses any number of creatures he or she controls and divides them into a number of piles equal to the number of attacking creatures for whom that player is the defending player. Creatures he or she controls that can block additional creatures may likewise be put into additional piles. Assign each pile to a different one of those attacking creatures at random. Each creature in a pile that can block the creature that pile is assigned to does so. (Piles can be empty.)
cards.originalText: You may rearrange your attacking creatures and place them face down, revealing which is which only after defense is chosen. If this results in impossible blocks, such as non-flying creatures blocking flying creatures, illegal blockers cannot block this turn.

cards.name: Castle
cards.text: Untapped creatures you control get +0/+2.
cards.originalText: Your untapped creatures gain +0/+2. Attacking creatures lose this bonus.

cards.name: Celestial Prism
cards.text: {2}, {T}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.
cards.originalText: {2}: Provides 1 mana of any color. This use can be played as an interrupt.

cards.name: Channel
cards.text: Until end of turn, any time you could activate a mana ability, you may pay 1 life. If you do, add {1} to your mana pool.
cards.originalText: Until end of turn, you may add colorless mana to your mana pool, at a cost of 1 life each. These additions are played with the speed of an interrupt. Effects that prevent damage may not be used to counter this loss of life.

rulings.text: You can't pay life you don't have. In other words, you can't Channel yourself below zero life.

cards.name: Chaos Orb
cards.text: {1}, {T}: If Chaos Orb is on the battlefield, flip Chaos Orb onto the battlefield from a height of at least one foot. If Chaos Orb turns over completely at least once during the flip, destroy all nontoken permanents it touches. Then destroy Chaos Orb.
cards.originalText: {1}: Flip Chaos Orb onto the playing area from a height of at least one foot. Chaos Orb must turn completely over at least once or it is discarded with no effect. When Chaos Orb lands, any cards in play that it touches are destroyed, as is Chaos Orb.

rulings.text: Chaos Orb can only affect permanents. Cards that are in the game but not on the battlefield, such as those in the Library and Graveyard, can't be affected.

You can arrange your cards any time before the Orb is put onto the battlefield, but not after. In general, you should not stack cards or put them in places where your opponent can't read the names of all of them or count them. This is recommended good gaming practice.
It must flip 360 degrees (that's what "flip" means). And this flip must be in the air and not in your hand.
This is a not a targeted ability.
If you have sleeves on cards, they count as the cards.
You can't interfere in any physical way with the casting of this card.

cards.name: Chaoslace
cards.text: Target spell or permanent becomes red. (Its mana symbols remain unchanged.)
cards.originalText: Changes the color of one card either being played or already in play to red. Cost to cast, tap, maintain, or use a special ability of target card remains entirely unchanged.

cards.name: Circle of Protection: Black
cards.text: {1}: The next time a black source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage.
cards.originalText: {1}: Prevents all damage against you from one black source. If a source does damage to you more than once in a turn, you must pay 1 mana each time to prevent the damage.

rulings.text: A source of damage is a permanent, a spell on the stack (including one that creates a permanent), or any object referred to by an object on the stack. A source doesn't need to be capable of dealing damage to be a legal choice.
Can be used even when there is no damage to prevent. It prevents the next damage (if any) from the source this turn.

cards.name: Circle of Protection: Blue
cards.text: {1}: The next time a blue source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage.
cards.originalText: {1}: Prevents all damage against you from one blue source. If a source does damage to you more than once in a turn, you must pay 1 mana each time to prevent the damage.

rulings.text: A source of damage is a permanent, a spell on the stack (including one that creates a permanent), or any object referred to by an object on the stack. A source doesn't need to be capable of dealing damage to be a legal choice.
Can be used even when there is no damage to prevent. It prevents the next damage (if any) from the source this turn.

cards.name: Circle of Protection: Green
cards.text: {1}: The next time a green source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage.
cards.originalText: {1}: Prevents all damage against you from one green source. If a source does damage to you more than once in a turn, you must pay 1 mana each time to prevent the damage.

rulings.text: A source of damage is a permanent, a spell on the stack (including one that creates a permanent), or any object referred to by an object on the stack. A source doesn't need to be capable of dealing damage to be a legal choice.
Can be used even when there is no damage to prevent. It prevents the next damage (if any) from the source this turn.

cards.name: Circle of Protection: Red
cards.text: {1}: The next time a red source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage.
cards.originalText: {1}: Prevents all damage against you from one red source. If a source does damage to you more than once in a turn, you must pay 1 mana each time to prevent the damage.

rulings.text: A source of damage is a permanent, a spell on the stack (including one that creates a permanent), or any object referred to by an object on the stack. A source doesn't need to be capable of dealing damage to be a legal choice.
Can be used even when there is no damage to prevent. It prevents the next damage (if any) from the source this turn.

cards.name: Circle of Protection: White
cards.text: {1}: The next time a white source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage.
cards.originalText: {1}: Prevents all damage against you from one white source. If a source does damage to you more than once in a turn, you must pay 1 mana each time to prevent the damage.

rulings.text: A source of damage is a permanent, a spell on the stack (including one that creates a permanent), or any object referred to by an object on the stack. A source doesn't need to be capable of dealing damage to be a legal choice.
Can be used even when there is no damage to prevent. It prevents the next damage (if any) from the source this turn.

cards.name: Clockwork Beast
cards.text:
Clockwork Beast enters the battlefield with seven +1/+0 counters on it.

At end of combat, if Clockwork Beast attacked or blocked this combat, remove a +1/+0 counter from it.

{X}, {T}: Put up to X +1/+0 counters on Clockwork Beast. This ability can't cause the total number of +1/+0 counters on Clockwork Beast to be greater than seven. Activate this ability only during your upkeep.
cards.originalText: Put seven +1/+0 counters on Beast. After Beast attacks or blocks a creature, discard a counter. During the untap phase, controller may buy back lost counters for 1 mana per counter instead of tapping Beast; this taps Beast if it wasn't tapped already.

rulings.text: Loses a counter even if it is affected by a Fog-like effect which prevents it from dealing damage.
Can attack or block even if it has no counters.
This is a change from the most recent wording. Now, if some other spell or ability causes +1/+0 counters to be put on Clockwork Beast, it can wind up with more than seven such counters on it.

If Clockwork Beast has seven or fewer +1/+0 counters on it when its last ability resolves, it can wind up a maximum of seven such counters on it. If it has seven or more +1/+0 counters on it, the ability will have no effect.
Clockwork Beast's last ability resolves, you can choose to put fewer than X +1/+0 counters on it.

cards.name: Clone
cards.text: You may have Clone enter the battlefield as a copy of any creature on the battlefield.
cards.originalText: Upon summoning, Clone acquires all characteristics, including color, of any one creature in play on either side; any creature enchantments on original creature are not copied. Clone retains these characteristics even after original creature is destroyed. Clone cannot be played if there are no creatures in play.

rulings.text: If the chosen creature is copying something else (for example, if the chosen creature is another Clone), then your Clone enters the battlefield as whatever the chosen creature copied.
If the chosen creature is a token, Clone copies the original characteristics of that token as stated by the effect that put it onto the battlefield. Clone is not a token.

Any enters-the-battlefield abilities of the copied creature will trigger when Clone enters the battlefield. Any "as [this creature] enters the battlefield" or "[this creature] enters the battlefield with" abilities of the chosen creature will also work.
If the chosen creature has {X} in its mana cost (such as Protean Hydra), X is considered to be zero.

Clone copies exactly what was printed on the original creature and nothing more (unless that creature is copying something else or is a token; see below). It doesn't copy whether that creature is tapped or untapped, whether it has any counters on it or Auras attached to it, or any non-copy effects that have changed its power, toughness, types, color, or so on.
If Clone somehow enters the battlefield at the same time as another creature, Clone can't become a copy of that creature. You may only choose a creature that's already on the battlefield.
You can choose not to copy anything. In that case, Clone enters the battlefield as a 0/0 Shapeshifter creature, and is probably put into the graveyard immediately.
Clone's ability doesn’t target the chosen creature.

cards.name: Cockatrice
cards.text:
Flying

Whenever Cockatrice blocks or becomes blocked by a non-Wall creature, destroy that creature at end of combat.
cards.originalText:
Flying

Any non-wall creature blocking Cockatrice is destroyed, as is any creature blocked by Cockatrice. Creatures destroyed in this way deal their damage before dying.

rulings.text: The ability destroys the creature at the end of the combat, which is after all first strike and normal damage dealing is done. This means that a creature may have to regenerate twice to survive the combat, once from damage and once again at end of combat.

cards.name: Consecrate Land
cards.text:
Enchant land

Enchanted land has indestructible and can't be enchanted by other Auras.
cards.originalText: All enchantments on target land are destroyed. Land cannot be destroyed or further enchanted until Consecrate Land has been destroyed.

rulings.text: The land can be targeted by land-destroying spells and the spell will resolve, but the land will simply not be destroyed.
If Consecrate Land enters the battlefield attached to a land that's enchanted by other Auras, those Auras are put into their owners' graveyards.
A permanent with indestructible can't be destroyed, but it can still be sacrificed, exiled, put into a graveyard, and so on.

cards.name: Conservator
cards.text: {3}, {T}: Prevent the next 2 damage that would be dealt to you this turn.
cards.originalText: {3}: Prevent the loss of up to 2 life.

cards.name: Contract from Below
cards.text:
Remove Contract from Below from your deck before playing if you're not playing for ante.

Discard your hand, add the top card of your library to the ante, then draw seven cards.
cards.originalText: Discard your current hand and draw eight new cards, adding the first drawn to your ante. Remove this card from your deck before playing if you are not playing for ante.

cards.name: Control Magic
cards.text:
Enchant creature

You control enchanted creature.
cards.originalText: You control target creature until enchantment is discarded or game ends. You can't tap target creature this turn, but if it was already tapped it stays tapped until you can untap it. If destroyed, target creature is put in its owner's graveyard.

rulings.text: You take control of a creature, but Auras enchanting and Equipment attached to the creature do not change controller.

cards.name: Conversion
cards.text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Conversion unless you pay {W}{W}.

All Mountains are Plains.
cards.originalText: All mountains are considered plains while Conversion is in play. Pay {W}{W} during upkeep or Conversion is discarded.

rulings.text: The Conversion effect is a continuous effect. There is no chance to tap a just-played mountain for red mana before it becomes a plains.
Will not add or remove Snow Supertype to or from a land.

cards.name: Copper Tablet
cards.text: At the beginning of each player's upkeep, Copper Tablet deals 1 damage to that player.
cards.originalText: Copper Tablet does 1 damage to each player during his or her upkeep.

cards.name: Copy Artifact
cards.text: You may have Copy Artifact enter the battlefield as a copy of any artifact on the battlefield, except it's an enchantment in addition to its other types.
cards.originalText: Select any artifact in play. This enchantment acts as a duplicate of that artifact; enchantment copy is affected by cards that affect either enchantments or artifacts. Enchantment copy remains even if original artifact is destroyed.

rulings.text: The copy is both an artifact and an enchantment, so it is an artifact-enchantment (perhaps even an artifact-creature-enchantment). It can be affected by anything which affects either type of permanent.
The copy of the artifact is not still blue. It copies the color of the thing it is copying.
The artifact to copy is chosen at the time this card enters the battlefield. If there is no valid artifact to choose, then this card enters the battlefield as an enchantment that has no effect.

cards.name: Counterspell
cards.text: Counter target spell.
cards.originalText: Counters target spell as it is being cast.

cards.name: Craw Wurm
cards.flavor: The most terrifying thing about the Craw Wurm is probably the horrible crashing sound it makes as it speeds through the forest. This noise is so loud it echoes through the trees and seems to come from all directions at once.

cards.name: Creature Bond
cards.text:
Enchant creature

When enchanted creature dies, Creature Bond deals damage equal to that creature's toughness to the creature's controller.
cards.originalText: If target creature is destroyed, Creature Bond does an amount of damage equal to creature's toughness to creature's controller.

cards.name: Crusade
cards.text: White creatures get +1/+1.
cards.originalText: All white creatures gain +1/+1.

cards.name: Crystal Rod
cards.text: Whenever a player casts a blue spell, you may pay {1}. If you do, you gain 1 life.
cards.originalText: {1}: Any blue spell cast by any player gives you 1 life.

cards.name: Cursed Land
cards.text:
Enchant land

At the beginning of the upkeep of enchanted land's controller, Cursed Land deals 1 damage to that player.
cards.originalText: Cursed Land does 1 damage to target land's controller during each upkeep.

cards.name: Cyclopean Tomb
cards.text:
{2}, {T}: Put a mire counter on target non-Swamp land. That land is a Swamp for as long as it has a mire counter on it. Activate this ability only during your upkeep.

When Cyclopean Tomb is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, at the beginning of each of your upkeeps for the rest of the game, remove all mire counters from a land that a mire counter was put onto with Cyclopean Tomb but that a mire counter has not been removed from with Cyclopean Tomb.
cards.originalText: {2}: Turn any one non-swamp land into swamp during upkeep. Mark the changed lands with tokens. If Cyclopean Tomb is destroyed, remove one token of your choice each upkeep, returning that land to its original nature.

rulings.text: Will not add or remove Snow Supertype to or from a land.

After leaving the battlefield, the ability triggers during each of your upkeeps for the rest of the game. As it resolves, you must remove a mire counter from a land that had a mire counter put on it by that instance of Cyclopean Tomb, but it doesn't matter where the mire counter you remove came from. For instance, you could remove mire counters that were put on the land by Gilder Bairn.
The land remains a Swamp as long as it has a mire counter on it. This effect is not tied to the Tomb remaining on the battlefield.

cards.name: Dark Ritual
cards.text: Add {B}{B}{B} to your mana pool.
cards.originalText: Add 3 black mana to your mana pool.
printings: Duel Decks: Phyrexia vs. the Coalition

cards.name: Darkpact
cards.text:
Remove Darkpact from your deck before playing if you're not playing for ante.

You own target card in the ante. Exchange that card with the top card of your library.
cards.originalText: Without looking at it first, swap top card of your library with either card of the ante; this swap is permanent. You must have a card in your library to cast this spell. Remove this card from your deck before playing if you are not playing for ante.

cards.name: Death Ward
cards.text: Regenerate target creature.
cards.originalText: Regenerates target creature.

cards.name: Deathgrip
cards.text: {B}{B}: Counter target green spell.
cards.originalText: {B}{B} Destroy a green spell as it is being cast. This action may be played as an interrupt, and does not affect green cards already in play.

cards.name: Deathlace
cards.text: Target spell or permanent becomes black. (Mana symbols on that permanent remain unchanged.)
cards.originalText: Changes the color of one card either being played or already in play to black. Cost to cast, tap, maintain, or use a special ability of target card remains entirely unchanged.

cards.name: Demonic Attorney
cards.text:
Remove Demonic Attorney from your deck before playing if you're not playing for ante.

Each player antes the top card of his or her library.
cards.originalText: If opponent doesn't concede the game immediately, each player must ante an additional card from the top of his or her library. Remove this card from your deck before playing if you are not playing for ante.

cards.name: Demonic Hordes
cards.text:
{T}: Destroy target land.

At the beginning of your upkeep, unless you pay {B}{B}{B}, tap Demonic Hordes and sacrifice a land of an opponent's choice.
cards.originalText: Tap to destroy 1 land. Pay {B}{B}{B} during upkeep or the Hordes become tapped and you lose a land of opponent's choice.
cards.flavor: Created to destroy Dominia, Demons can sometimes be bent to a more focused purpose.

cards.name: Demonic Tutor
cards.text: Search your library for a card and put that card into your hand. Then shuffle your library.
cards.originalText: You may search your library for one card and take it into your hand. Reshuffle your library afterwards.

rulings.text: You pick a card on resolution.
You don't reveal the card to your opponent.
This card is put directly into your hand. It is not drawn.

cards.name: Dingus Egg
cards.text: Whenever a land is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, Dingus Egg deals 2 damage to that land's controller.
cards.originalText: Whenever anyone loses a land, Egg does 2 damage to that player for each land lost.

cards.name: Disenchant
cards.text: Destroy target artifact or enchantment.
cards.originalText: Target enchantment or artifact must be discarded.

rulings.text: This is not modal. If the target changes from an artifact to an enchantment or vice versa, this still destroys it.

cards.name: Disintegrate
cards.text: Disintegrate deals X damage to target creature or player. That creature can't be regenerated this turn. If the creature would die this turn, exile it instead.
cards.originalText: Disintegrate does X damage to one target. If target dies this turn, it is removed from game entirely and cannot be regenerated. Return target to its owner's deck only when game is over.

rulings.text: The "can't regenerate" is an effect of Disintegrate and not an effect of the damage. It works even if the damage is prevented or redirected. If redirected, the damage does not take this effect with it.
Disintegrated creatures do not go to the graveyard at all before being exiled. They do not trigger abilities which trigger due to a creature going to the graveyard.

cards.name: Disrupting Scepter
cards.text: {3}, {T}: Target player discards a card. Activate this ability only during your turn.
cards.originalText: {3}: Opponent must discard one card of his or her choice. Can only be used during your turn.

rulings.text: You can use it on yourself.

cards.name: Dragon Whelp
cards.text:
Flying

{R}: Dragon Whelp gets +1/+0 until end of turn. If this ability has been activated four or more times this turn, sacrifice Dragon Whelp at the beginning of the next end step.
cards.originalText:
Flying

{R} +1/+0 until end of turn; if more than {R}{R}{R} is spent in this way, Dragon Whelp is destroyed at end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"O to be a dragon . . . of silkworm size or immense . . ."

—Marianne Moore, "O to Be a Dragon"

rulings.text: The first three times Dragon Whelp's ability is activated in a turn will do nothing other than give it +1/+0 until end of turn. Any subsequent activations will also cause its delayed triggered ability to trigger. That means if you activate Dragon Whelp's ability five times, for example, two different delayed triggered abilities will trigger at the beginning of the next end step and cause you to sacrifice Dragon Whelp.

If the fourth (or more) time Dragon Whelp's ability is activated during the same turn happens to be during that turn's end step, the delayed triggered ability won't trigger until the beginning of the next turn's end step. You'll have to sacrifice Dragon Whelp at that time.

cards.name: Drain Life
cards.text:
Spend only black mana on X.

Drain Life deals X damage to target creature or player. You gain life equal to the damage dealt, but not more life than the player's life total before Drain Life dealt damage or the creature's toughness.
cards.originalText: Drain Life does 1 damage to a single target for each {B} spent in addition to the casting cost. Caster gains 1 life for each damage inflicted. If you drain life from a creature, you cannot gain more life than the creature's toughness.

rulings.text: Cost reducers can be used to reduce the X part of the mana cost.
You may gain up to the total toughness of the creature even if it was already damaged.

cards.name: Drain Power
cards.text: Target player activates a mana ability of each land he or she controls. Then put all mana from that player's mana pool into yours.
cards.originalText: Tap all opponent's land, taking all this mana and all mana in opponent's mana pool into your mana pool. You can't tap fewer than all opponent's lands.

rulings.text: This card forces the target player to draw mana from lands if they are untapped, but that player can choose how to draw the mana if a land he or she controls has multiple mana abilities, or mana abilities with choices.
Since this is a sorcery, your opponent may use instants and abilities of permanents in response to this spell before you get the mana from their mana pool and lands.
If a land can draw a variable amount of mana, the target player (not the player of this spell) chooses how much to draw.
A mana ability is an ability that (1) isn't a loyalty ability, (2) doesn't target, and (3) could put mana into a player's mana pool when it resolves.

cards.name: Drudge Skeletons
cards.text: {B}: Regenerate Drudge Skeletons. (The next time this creature would be destroyed this turn, it isn't. Instead tap it, remove all damage from it, and remove it from combat.)
cards.originalText: {B} Regenerates
cards.flavor: Bones scattered around us joined to form misshapen bodies. We struck at them repeatedly—they fell, but soon formed again, with the same mocking look on their faceless skulls.

cards.name: Dwarven Demolition Team
cards.text: {T}: Destroy target Wall.
cards.originalText: Tap to destroy a wall.
cards.flavor: Foolishly, Najib retreated to his castle at El-Abar; the next morning he was dead. In just one night, the dwarven forces had reduced the mighty walls to mere rubble.

cards.name: Dwarven Warriors
cards.text: {T}: Target creature with power 2 or less can't be blocked this turn.
cards.originalText: Tap to make a creature of power no greater than 2 unblockable until end of turn. Other cards may later be used to increase target creature's power beyond 2 after defense is chosen.

rulings.text: The ability can be activated after a creature is blocked, but it has no effect. Once a creature is blocked, it can't be unblocked.
If you increase the power of the targeted creature after the ability resolves, it still can't be blocked that turn.

cards.name: Earth Elemental
cards.flavor: Earth Elementals have the eternal strength of stone and the endurance of mountains. Primordially connected to the land they inhabit, they take a long-term view of things, scorning the impetuous haste of short-lived mortal creatures.

cards.name: Earthbind
cards.text:
Enchant creature

When Earthbind enters the battlefield, if enchanted creature has flying, Earthbind deals 2 damage to that creature and Earthbind gains "Enchanted creature loses flying."
cards.originalText: Earthbind does 2 damage to target flying creature, which also loses flying ability.

rulings.text: If the enchanted creature gains flying after Earthbind is put onto it, it will have flying. The two effects are simply applied in timestamp order.

cards.name: Earthquake
cards.text: Earthquake deals X damage to each creature without flying and each player.
cards.originalText: Does X damage to each player and each non-flying creature in play.

rulings.text: Whether or not a creature is without flying is only checked on resolution.

cards.name: Elvish Archers
cards.text: First strike
cards.originalText: First strike
cards.flavor: I tell you, there was so many arrows flying about you couldn't hardly see the sun. So I says to young Angus, "Well, at least now we're fighting in the shade"

cards.name: Evil Presence
cards.text:
Enchant land

Enchanted land is a Swamp.
cards.originalText: Target land is now a swamp.

rulings.text: The enchanted land loses its existing land types and any abilities printed on it. It now has the land type Swamp and has the ability "{T}: Add {B} to your mana pool." Evil Presence doesn't change the enchanted land's name or whether it's legendary, basic, or snow.

cards.name: False Orders
cards.text:
Cast False Orders only during the declare blockers step.

Remove target creature defending player controls from combat. Creatures it was blocking that had become blocked by only that creature this combat become unblocked. You may have it block an attacking creature of your choice.
cards.originalText: You decide whether and how one defending creature blocks, though you can't make a choice the defender couldn't legally make. Play after defender has chosen defense but before damage is dealt.

rulings.text: If a creature is removed from being a blocker of a given attacker, any triggered abilities that would have happened because it was declared as a blocker still happen.

cards.name: Farmstead
cards.text:
Enchant land

Enchanted land has "At the beginning of your upkeep, you may pay {W}{W}. If you do, you gain 1 life."
cards.originalText: Target land's controller gains 1 life each upkeep if {W}{W} is spent. Target land still generates mana as usual.

cards.name: Fastbond
cards.text:
You may play any number of additional lands on each of your turns.

Whenever you play a land, if it wasn't the first land you played this turn, Fastbond deals 1 damage to you.
cards.originalText: You may put as many lands into play as you want each turn. Fastbond does 1 damage to you for every land beyond the first that you play in a single turn.

rulings.text: You take damage when you play a land using the "play a land" action. Such an action can be your regular "play a land", one enabled by Fastbond, or ones enabled through other effects.
You do not take damage when you "put a land onto the battlefield" through the effect of a spell or ability.

cards.name: Fear
cards.text:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.)

Enchanted creature has fear. (It can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)
cards.originalText: Target creature cannot be blocked by any creatures other than artifact creatures and black creatures.

cards.name: Feedback
cards.text:
Enchant enchantment

At the beginning of the upkeep of enchanted enchantment's controller, Feedback deals 1 damage to that player.
cards.originalText: Feedback does 1 damage to controller of target enchantment during each upkeep.

cards.name: Fire Elemental
cards.flavor: Fire Elementals are ruthless infernos, annihilating and consuming their foes in a frenzied holocaust. Crackling and blazing, they sear swift, terrible paths, leaving the land charred and scorched in their wake.

cards.name: Fireball
cards.text:
Fireball deals X damage divided evenly, rounded down, among any number of target creatures and/or players.

Fireball costs {1} more to cast for each target beyond the first.
cards.originalText: Fireball does X damage total, divided evenly (round down) among any number of targets. Pay 1 extra mana for each target beyond the first.

rulings.text: The additional cost is paid when you pay the rest of Fireball's costs, even though that text appears second on the card (to make the card easier to read). The additional cost doesn't count toward Fireball's converted mana cost.

If, for example, X is 5 and you choose three target creatures, Fireball has a total cost of {7}{R} (even though its mana cost is just {5}{R}). If those creatures are all still legal targets as Fireball resolves, it deals 1 damage to each of them.
You may cast Fireball with zero targets, regardless of the value chosen for X. If you do so, it will not be a targeted spell, and no damage will actually be dealt when it resolves.
Fireball's damage is divided as Fireball resolves, not as it's cast, because there are no choices involved. The division involves only targets that are still legal at that time.
You can target more than X creatures. However, if the number of legal targets at the time Fireball resolves is greater than X, none of them will be dealt any damage.

printings: Premium Deck Series: Fire and Lightning

cards.name: Firebreathing
cards.text:
Enchant creature

{R}: Enchanted creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"And topples round the dreary west

A looming bastion fringed with fire."

—Alfred, Lord Tennyson, "In Memoriam"

rulings.text: This ability can be activated by Firebreathing's controller, not the enchanted creature's controller (in case they're different players).
The ability affects whichever creature is enchanted by Firebreathing at the time the ability resolves. The bonus remains even if Firebreathing stops enchanting that creature.

cards.name: Flashfires
cards.text: Destroy all Plains.
cards.originalText: All plains in play are destroyed.

cards.name: Flight
cards.text:
Enchant creature

Enchanted creature has flying.
cards.originalText: Target creature is now a flying creature.

cards.name: Fog
cards.text: Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt this turn.
cards.originalText: Creatures attack and block as normal, but none deal any damage. All attacking creatures are still tapped. Play any time before attack damage is dealt.

rulings.text: Fog has no effect on damage that's already been dealt.

cards.name: Force of Nature
cards.text:
Trample (If this creature would assign enough damage to its blockers to destroy them, you may have it assign the rest of its damage to defending player or planeswalker.)

At the beginning of your upkeep, Force of Nature deals 8 damage to you unless you pay {G}{G}{G}{G}.
cards.originalText:
Trample

You must pay {G}{G}{G}{G} during upkeep or Force of Nature does 8 damage to you. You may still attack with Force of Nature even if you failed to pay the upkeep.

cards.name: Forcefield
cards.text: {1}: The next time an unblocked creature of your choice would deal combat damage to you this turn, prevent all but 1 of that damage.
cards.originalText: {1}: Lose only 1 life to an unblocked creature.

rulings.text: This can't be used to prevent damage caused by a blocked creature with Trample ability.

cards.name: Forest
cards.text: G
cards.originalText: Tap to add {G} to your mana pool.
printings: Duel Decks: Phyrexia vs. the Coalition
Duel Decks: Ajani vs. Nicol Bolas

cards.name: Forest
cards.text: G
cards.originalText: Tap to add {G} to your mana pool.
printings: Duel Decks: Phyrexia vs. the Coalition
Duel Decks: Ajani vs. Nicol Bolas

cards.name: Forest
cards.text: G
cards.originalText: Tap to add {G} to your mana pool.
printings: Duel Decks: Phyrexia vs. the Coalition
Duel Decks: Ajani vs. Nicol Bolas

cards.name: Fork
cards.text: Copy target instant or sorcery spell, except that the copy is red. You may choose new targets for the copy.
cards.originalText: Any sorcery or instant spell just cast is doubled. Treat Fork as an exact copy of target spell except that Fork remains red. Copy and original may have different targets.

rulings.text: When a spell with additional costs is copied, you don't have to pay those costs again.
For spells that can have a variable number of targets, the controller of the copy must use the same number of targets the original spell did.
Forking a spell with an X in the cost requires you to use the same X value.
Fork will not copy changes made by modifying effects to the spell prior to the use of Fork, such as text-changing effects.
If mana or other costs need to be spent at resolution of the spell, the player of Fork would still be responsible for paying that cost.
You need not (and may not) pay any additional mana or other costs (like sacrifices) to use the spell which is Forked. You get control over a complete copy but can change nothing except the targets.
Fork does not let you make non-targeting choices about the spell.

If the spell being copied targets a spell on the stack, it is possible to target Fork itself since Fork is still on the stack when you pick the target(s) for the copy. Note that the copy's target will be illegal when it resolves.
If you copy a spell for which Buyback has been paid, you get nothing back since the copied spell does not have a card to give you.
The copy that is placed on the stack is not considered to have been "cast".
The Fork card goes to the graveyard when it resolves and leaves the copy on the stack. There is no card representing the copy on the stack.

It does copy the mana symbols in the mana cost for the card it is copying, but it uses its own color definition and not the one from those mana symbols. This is so it maintains its color just like the text says.
If you Fork a Spliced spell, the spliced text is added during the announcement of the original spell, and therefore is fully copied by Fork.
The copy will have the same mana cost as the original spell, but will be red rather than whatever color that mana cost would have made it.
If the targeted spell was kicked, then the copy will be kicked as well. If the targeted spell was not kicked, then the copy will not be kicked.

cards.name: Frozen Shade
cards.text: {B}: Frozen Shade gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"There are some qualities—some incorporate things,/ That have a double life, which thus is made/ A type of twin entity which springs/ From matter and light, evinced in solid and shade."

—Edgar Allan Poe, "Silence"

cards.name: Fungusaur
cards.text: Whenever Fungusaur is dealt damage, put a +1/+1 counter on it.
cards.originalText: Each time Fungusaur is damaged but not destroyed, put a +1/+1 counter on it.
cards.flavor: Rather than sheltering her young, the female Fungusaur often injures her own offspring, thereby ensuring their rapid growth.

rulings.text: If more than one creature damages it at one time, it only gets one counter.

cards.name: Gaea's Liege
cards.text:
As long as Gaea's Liege isn't attacking, its power and toughness are each equal to the number of Forests you control. As long as Gaea's Liege is attacking, its power and toughness are each equal to the number of Forests defending player controls.

{T}: Target land becomes a Forest until Gaea's Liege leaves the battlefield.
cards.originalText: When defending, Gaea's Liege has power and toughness equal to the number of forests you have in play; when it's attacking, they are equal to the number of forests opponent has in play. Tap to turn any one land into a forest until Gaea's Liege leaves play. Mark changed lands with counters, removing the counters when Gaea's Liege leaves play.

rulings.text: When being declared as an attacker, use the "not attacking" power and toughness. It only changes after declaration is complete.
The activated ability doesn't affect whether the land is basic or not. It overwrites any other land types. Being a Forest gives the affected land the ability "{T}: Add {G} to your mana pool."
Will not add or remove Snow Supertype to or from a land.

cards.name: Gauntlet of Might
cards.text:
Red creatures get +1/+1.

Whenever a Mountain is tapped for mana, its controller adds {R} to his or her mana pool (in addition to the mana the land produces).
cards.originalText: All red creatures gain +1/+1 and all mountains provide an extra red mana when tapped.

rulings.text: Dual lands which have Mountain as one of their types produce an extra red mana when tapped for either color.

cards.name: Giant Growth
cards.text: Target creature gets +3/+3 until end of turn.
cards.originalText: Target creature gains +3/+3 until end of turn.

cards.name: Giant Spider
cards.text: Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
cards.originalText: Does not fly, but can block flying creatures.
cards.flavor: While it possesses potent venom, the Giant Spider often chooses not to paralyze its victims. Perhaps the creature enjoys the gentle rocking motion caused by its captives' struggles to escape its web.

rulings.text: This card now uses the Reach keyword ability to enable the blocking of flying creatures. This works because a creature with flying can only be blocked by creatures with flying or reach.

cards.name: Glasses of Urza
cards.text: {T}: Look at target player's hand.
cards.originalText: You may look at opponent's hand.

cards.name: Gloom
cards.text:
White spells cost {3} more to cast.

Activated abilities of white enchantments cost {3} more to activate.
cards.originalText: White spells cost 3 more mana to cast. Circles of Protection cost 3 more mana to use.

rulings.text: The extra mana is not considered part of the activation cost. It is a separate cost.
The additional mana is paid at the same time the spell/ability is cast/activated.
The extra mana is part of the total cost, so cost reducers can be applied to this cost.
Activated abilities contain a colon. They're generally written "[Cost]: [Effect]." Some keywords are activated abilities; they have colons in their reminder text.

cards.name: Goblin Balloon Brigade
cards.text: {R}: Goblin Balloon Brigade gains flying until end of turn.
cards.originalText: {R} Goblins gain flying ability until end of turn. Controller may not choose to make Goblins fly after they have been blocked.
cards.flavor: "From up here we can drop rocks and arrows and more rocks" "Uh, yeah boss, but how do we get down?"

rulings.text: You can activate the ability repeatedly during a turn. This generally has no additional effect, unless some other effect (like that from Adarkar Windform has caused it to lose flying since the last time the ability resolved.

For flying to work as an evasion ability, an attacking Goblin Balloon Brigade's ability must be activated before the declare blockers step begins. Once Goblin Balloon Brigade has become blocked, giving it flying won't change that.

cards.name: Goblin King
cards.text: Other Goblin creatures get +1/+1 and have mountainwalk. (They can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Mountain.)
cards.originalText: Goblins in play gain mountainwalk and +1/+1 while this card remains in play.
cards.flavor: To become king of the Goblins, one must assassinate the previous king. Thus, only the most foolish seek positions of leadership.

rulings.text: Goblin King now has the Goblin creature type and its ability has been reworded to affect *other* Goblins. This means that if two Goblin Kings are on the battlefield, each gives the other a bonus.

cards.name: Granite Gargoyle
cards.text:
Flying

{R}: Granite Gargoyle gets +0/+1 until end of turn.
cards.originalText: Flying; {R} +0/+1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"While most overworlders fortunately don't realize this, Gargoyles can be most delicious, providing you have the appropriate tools to carve them."

—The Underworld Cookbook by Asmoranomardicadaistinaculdacar

cards.name: Gray Ogre
cards.flavor: The Ogre philosopher Gnerdel believed the purpose of life was to live as high on the food chain as possible. She refused to eat vegetarians, and preferred to live entirely on creatures that preyed on sentient beings.

cards.name: Green Ward
cards.text:
Enchant creature

Enchanted creature has protection from green. This effect doesn't remove Green Ward.
cards.originalText: Target creature gains protection from green.

cards.name: Grizzly Bears
cards.flavor: Don't try to outrun one of Dominia's Grizzlies; it'll catch you, knock you down, and eat you. Of course, you could run up a tree. In that case you'll get a nice view before it knocks the tree down and eats you.

cards.name: Guardian Angel
cards.text: Prevent the next X damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn. Until end of turn, you may pay {1} any time you could cast an instant. If you do, prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to that creature or player this turn.
cards.originalText: Prevents X damage from being dealt to any one target. Any further damage to the same target this turn can be canceled by spending 1 mana per point of damage to be canceled.

cards.name: Healing Salve
cards.text: Choose one — Target player gains 3 life; or prevent the next 3 damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn.
cards.originalText: Gain 3 life, or prevent up to 3 damage from being dealt to a single target.

cards.name: Helm of Chatzuk
cards.text: {1}, {T}: Target creature gains banding until end of turn. (Any creatures with banding, and up to one without, can attack in a band. Bands are blocked as a group. If any creatures with banding a player controls are blocking or being blocked by a creature, that player divides that creature's combat damage, not its controller, among any of the creatures it's being blocked by or is blocking.)
cards.originalText: {1}: You may give one creature the ability to band until end of turn.

rulings.text: If a creature with banding attacks, it can team up with any number of other attacking creatures with banding (and up to one nonbanding creature) and attack as a unit called a "band." The band can be blocked by any creature that could block a single creature in the band. Blocking any creature in a band blocks the entire band. If a creature with banding is blocked, the attacking player chooses how the blockers' damage is assigned.
A maximum of one nonbanding creature can join an attacking band no matter how many creatures with banding are in it.
Creatures in the same band must all attack the same player or planeswalker.
If a creature in combat has banding, its controller assigns damage for creatures blocking or blocked by it. That player can ignore the damage assignment order when making this assignment.

cards.name: Hill Giant
cards.flavor: Fortunately, Hill Giants have large blind spots in which a human can easily hide. Unfortunately, these blind spots are beneath the bottoms of their feet.

cards.name: Holy Armor
cards.text:
Enchant creature

Enchanted creature gets +0/+2.

{W}: Enchanted creature gets +0/+1 until end of turn.
cards.originalText: Target creature gains +0/+2. {W} Target creature gets extra +0/+1 until end of turn.

cards.name: Holy Strength
cards.text:
Enchant creature

Enchanted creature gets +1/+2.
cards.originalText: Target creature gains +1/+2.

cards.name: Howl from Beyond
cards.text: Target creature gets +X/+0 until end of turn.
cards.originalText: Target creature gains +X/+0 until end of turn.

cards.name: Howling Mine
cards.text: At the beginning of each player's draw step, if Howling Mine is untapped, that player draws an additional card.
cards.originalText: Each player draws one extra card each turn during his or her draw phase.

rulings.text: If Howling Mine leaves the battlefield before it resolves, then the last known tap or untap state of the card is used for resolution.
It does not trigger at all if this is tapped at the start of the draw step, and it checks this again on resolution.
The additional draw is separate from any other draw during your draw step. It happens when the triggered ability resolves.
The triggered ability is put onto the stack after you have already drawn your card for the turn.

cards.name: Hurloon Minotaur
cards.flavor: The Minotaurs of the Hurloon Mountains are known for their love of battle. They are also known for their hymns to the dead, sung for friend and foe alike. These hymns can last for days, filling the mountain valleys with their low, haunting sounds.

cards.name: Hurricane
cards.text: Hurricane deals X damage to each creature with flying and each player.
cards.originalText: All players and flying creatures suffer X damage.

rulings.text: Whether or not a creature has flying is only checked on resolution.

cards.name: Hypnotic Specter
cards.text:
Flying

Whenever Hypnotic Specter deals damage to an opponent, that player discards a card at random.
cards.originalText:
Flying

An opponent damaged by Specter must discard a card at random from his or her hand. Ignore this effect if opponent has no cards left in hand.
cards.flavor:
"...There was no trace/ Of aught on that illumined face..."

—Samuel Coleridge, "Phantom"

rulings.text: The ability triggers even if the Specter's damage is being redirected to an opponent. It does not trigger if damage that would have been dealt to the opponent is redirected to a nonopponent player or a creature, or if the damage is prevented.

cards.name: Ice Storm
cards.text: Destroy target land.
cards.originalText: Destroys any one land.

cards.name: Icy Manipulator
cards.text: {1}, {T}: Tap target artifact, creature, or land.
cards.originalText: {1}: You may tap any land, creature, or artifact in play on either side. No effects are generated by the target card.

rulings.text: Tapping a card with an effect like this will never pay the cost of an ability. For example, tapping a land with this card will not put mana into a player's pool.
Icy Manipulator can't be used to stop someone from using an ability of the permanent you plan to tap. It can be used to make a player use the ability now or to not use it.
The ability can target a tapped card, but tapping a tapped card does nothing useful. And it will not trigger "if the card becomes tapped" effects.

If you want to stop someone from attacking with a creature by using this card, you must do so before attackers are declared. You can't wait until after attackers are declared and then try to use it to make a creature stop attacking. Note that your opponent can't start declaring attackers without letting you use the Icy Manipulator.
Tapping an attacking creature which did not tap to attack does not remove the creature from the attack or cause the creature to stop dealing damage.

printings: Duel Decks: Ajani vs. Nicol Bolas

cards.name: Illusionary Mask
cards.text: {X}: You may choose a creature card in your hand whose mana cost could be paid by some amount of, or all of, the mana you spent on {X}. If you do, you may cast that card face down as a 2/2 creature spell without paying its mana cost. If the creature that spell becomes as it resolves has not been turned face up and would assign or deal damage, be dealt damage, or become tapped, instead it's turned face up and assigns or deals damage, is dealt damage, or becomes tapped. Activate this ability only any time you could cast a sorcery.
cards.originalText: {X} You can summon a creature face down so opponent doesn't know what it is. The X cost can be any amount of mana, even 0; it serves to hide the true casting cost of the creature, which you still have to spend. As soon as a face-down creature receives damage, deals damage, or is tapped, you must turn it face up.

rulings.text: The creature enters the battlefield face down, so none of its "enters the battlefield" abilities will trigger or have any effect. Also none of its "As this enters the battlefield" abilities apply.
The creature's "enters the battlefield" abilities (and any other abilities relating to the creature entering the battlefield) do not trigger when it turns face up.
Only the controller of the face down creature can look at it.
A "creature card" is any card with the type Creature, even if it has other types such as Artifact, Enchantment, or Land. Older cards of type Summon are also Creature cards.

If you use the ability to cast a creature card face down, you must keep track of the amount and types of mana you spent on {X}. If that creature spell is moved from the stack to anywhere other than the battlefield, the resulting creature leaves the battlefield, or the game ends, the face-down card is revealed. If its mana cost couldn't be paid by some amount of, or all of, the mana you spent on {X}, all applicable penalties for casting a card illegally are assessed.
You actually cast the card face-down, much as when playing a spell with Morph. It can be responded to and countered.
The effect that turns it face-up is a replacement effect. It doesn't use the stack and can't be responded to.

You may not turn a face-down spell face up. You may not turn a face-down permanent face up unless it would have morph while face up or an effect specifically allows you to turn it face up. Illusionary Mask's ability has you turn a face-down creature face up if it would assign damage, deal damage, be dealt damage, or become tapped, but not for any other reason. For example, if you use Illusionary Mask's ability to cast a black creature face down, you can't turn it face up just because it's being targeted by Terror.

Both the amount and types of mana you spend on {X} are taken into account while you're choosing a creature card from your hand. For example, if you spent {U}{U} on {X}, you can choose a creature card with mana cost {U}{U}, {1}{U}, {2}, or {W/U}{W/U}, among other possibilities, but not one that costs {2}{U} or one that costs {G}.
While the creature card is face down, it's a 2/2 creature with no name, mana cost, color, creature type, abilities, or expansion symbol. Since it has no mana cost, its converted mana cost is 0.
You may look at a face-down spell or permanent you control at any time.

You can turn a face-down permanent face up if it would have morph while face up. This applies to creatures you cast face down as a result of Illusionary Mask's effect. The rest of Illusionary Mask's effect applies to it as well.
Illusionary Mask's ability will continue to apply to creatures cast face down with it, even if Illusionary Mask has left the battlefield.

cards.name: Instill Energy
cards.text:
Enchant creature

Enchanted creature can attack as though it had haste.

{0}: Untap enchanted creature. Activate this ability only during your turn and only once each turn.
cards.originalText: You may untap target creature both during your untap phase and one additional time during your turn. Target creature may attack the turn it comes into play.

rulings.text: If attached to an opponent's creature, you can untap their creature during your turn.
Instill Energy's untap ability will not untap the creature until it resolves. This means other spells and abilities can be used before it actually becomes untapped.

Any Auras (or other effects) which are on the creature that would cause it to not be untapped (or have a cost to be untapped) during untap step do not in any way hinder or imply a cost to use this card's ability to untap once during the turn.

cards.name: Invisibility
cards.text:
Enchant creature

Enchanted creature can't be blocked except by Walls.
cards.originalText: Target creature can be blocked only by walls.

cards.name: Iron Star
cards.text: Whenever a player casts a red spell, you may pay {1}. If you do, you gain 1 life.
cards.originalText: {1}: Any red spell cast by any player gives you 1 life.

cards.name: Ironclaw Orcs
cards.text: Ironclaw Orcs can't block creatures with power 2 or greater.
cards.originalText: Cannot be used to block any creature of power more than 1.
cards.flavor: Generations of genetic weeding have given rise to the deviously cowardly Ironclaw clan. To say that Orcs in general are vicious, depraved, and ignoble does not do justice to the Ironclaw.

cards.name: Ironroot Treefolk
cards.flavor: The mating habits of Treefolk, particularly the stalwart Ironroot Treefolk, are truly absurd. Molasses comes to mind. It's amazing the species can survive at all given such protracted periods of mate selection, conjugation, and gestation.

cards.name: Island
cards.text: U
cards.originalText: Tap to add {U} to your mana pool.
printings: Duel Decks: Phyrexia vs. the Coalition
Duel Decks: Ajani vs. Nicol Bolas

cards.name: Island
cards.text: U
cards.originalText: Tap to add {U} to your mana pool.
printings: Duel Decks: Phyrexia vs. the Coalition
Duel Decks: Ajani vs. Nicol Bolas

cards.name: Island
cards.text: U
cards.originalText: Tap to add {U} to your mana pool.
printings: Duel Decks: Phyrexia vs. the Coalition
Duel Decks: Ajani vs. Nicol Bolas

cards.name: Island Sanctuary
cards.text: If you would draw a card during your draw step, instead you may skip that draw. If you do, until your next turn, you can't be attacked except by creatures with flying and/or islandwalk.
cards.originalText: You may decline to draw a card from your library during draw phase. In exchange, until start of your next turn the only creatures that may attack you are those that fly or have islandwalk.

rulings.text: If you get multiple draws or you use a spell or ability during the draw step to draw extra cards, you can have the replacement effect apply to any one or all of those. You need only have it apply once to get the effect. If you skip more than one, there is no additional effect.
If the replacement effect is applied, the effect will continue until your next turn even if this card leaves the battlefield.
Since the draw is replaced, you can't use the same draw to do other things.

cards.name: Ivory Cup
cards.text: Whenever a player casts a white spell, you may pay {1}. If you do, you gain 1 life.
cards.originalText: {1}: Any white spell cast by any player gives you 1 life.

cards.name: Jade Monolith
cards.text: {1}: The next time a source of your choice would deal damage to target creature this turn, that source deals that damage to you instead.
cards.originalText: {1}: You may take damage done to any creature on yourself instead, but you must take all of it. Source of damage is unchanged.

cards.name: Jade Statue
cards.text: {2}: Jade Statue becomes a 3/6 Golem artifact creature until end of combat. Activate this ability only during combat.
cards.originalText: {2}: Jade Statue becomes a creature for the duration of the current attack exchange. Can be a creature only during an attack or defense.
cards.flavor: "Some of the other guys dared me to touch it, but I knew it weren't no ordinary hunk o' rock."Norin the Wary

rulings.text: It can only make itself into a creature during combat phases and therefore it is difficult to get Auras placed on it.

A delayed triggered ability that refers to Jade Statue still affects it even if it's no longer a creature. For example, if Jade Statue blocks the Kashi-Tribe Warriors ("Whenever Kashi-Tribe Warriors deals combat damage to a creature, tap that creature and it doesn't untap during its controller's next untap step."), the Warriors' effect stops Jade Statue from untapping.
If Jade Statue's ability has been activated, abilities that trigger "at end of combat" will see Jade Statue as an artifact creature.

A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature can attack, and its {T} abilities can be activated, only if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of his or her most recent turn. It doesn't matter how long the permanent has been a creature.

If Jade Statue is animated by some other effect, you get an artifact creature with whatever power, toughness, and creature types (if any) are specified by that effect. If you subsequently use Jade Statue's ability during combat, it will become 3/6 and gain the creature type Golem in addition to those creature types until end of combat.

cards.name: Jayemdae Tome
cards.text: {4}, {T}: Draw a card.
cards.originalText: {4}: You may draw one extra card.

cards.name: Juggernaut
cards.text:
Juggernaut attacks each turn if able.

Juggernaut can't be blocked by Walls.
cards.originalText: Must attack each turn if possible. Can't be blocked by walls.
cards.flavor: We had taken refuge in a small cave, thinking the entrance was too narrow for it to follow. To our horror, its gigantic head smashed into the mountainside, ripping itself a new entrance.

rulings.text: An effect that says "can't be blocked except by Walls" doesn't override the text on the Juggernaut's ability. If Juggernaut is affected by such an effect, it can't be blocked.
There is no penalty if for some reason the Juggernaut can't attack, but if it can attack, it must.

If, during your declare attackers step, Juggernaut is tapped, is affected by a spell or ability that says it can't attack, or is affected by "summoning sickness," then it doesn't attack. If there's a cost associated with having Juggernaut attack, you aren't forced to pay that cost, so it doesn't have to attack in that case either.
If there are multiple combat phases in a turn, Juggernaut must attack only in the first one in which it's able to.

cards.name: Jump
cards.text: Target creature gains flying until end of turn.
cards.originalText: Target creature is a flying creature until end of turn.

rulings.text: To work as an evasion ability, an attacking creature must already have flying when the declare blockers step begins. Once a creature has become blocked, giving it flying won't change that.

cards.name: Karma
cards.text: At the beginning of each player's upkeep, Karma deals damage to that player equal to the number of Swamps he or she controls.
cards.originalText: For each swamp in play, Karma does 1 damage to the swamp owner during the swamp owner's upkeep.

rulings.text: Amount of damage is determined when the ability resolves and not when it is placed on the stack.

cards.name: Keldon Warlord
cards.text: Keldon Warlord's power and toughness are each equal to the number of non-Wall creatures you control.
cards.originalText: The Xs below are the number of non-wall creatures on your side, including Warlord. Thus if you have 2 other non-wall creatures, Warlord is 3/3. If one of those creatures is killed during the turn, Warlord immediately becomes 2/2.

rulings.text: This is a Characteristic-Defining Ability. It checks the number of non-Wall creatures you control continuously, and applies in all zones. It is never "locked in".

cards.name: Kormus Bell
cards.text: All Swamps are 1/1 black creatures that are still lands.
cards.originalText: Treat all swamps in play as 1/1 creatures. Now they can be enchanted, killed, and so forth, and they can be tapped either for mana or to attack. Swamps have no color; they are not considered black cards.

rulings.text: The lands are both lands and creatures at the same time. They are affected by anything that affects either permanent type.
It affects Swamps controlled by any and all players.

A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature can attack, and its {T} abilities can be activated, only if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of his or her most recent turn. It doesn't matter how long the permanent has been a creature.

cards.name: Kudzu
cards.text:
Enchant land

When enchanted land becomes tapped, destroy it. That land's controller attaches Kudzu to a land of his or her choice.
cards.originalText: When target land becomes tapped, it is destroyed. Unless that was the last land in play, Kudzu is not discarded; instead, the player whose land it just destroyed may place it on another land of his or her choice.

rulings.text: You can move it to any other player's land whenever you get to move it.
If Kudzu is destroyed directly, or the land is destroyed by a spell or ability, then Kudzu goes to the graveyard like any Aura would.
The controller of the destroyed land must attach it to another land if possible. If there are no valid choices, Kudzu is simply put into the graveyard.
Because the ability isn't targeted, the controller of the destroyed land may attach it to a land that can't be the target of abilities.

cards.name: Lance
cards.text:
Enchant creature

Enchanted creature has first strike.
cards.originalText: Target creature gains first strike.

cards.name: Ley Druid
cards.text: {T}: Untap target land.
cards.originalText: Tap Druid to untap a land of your choice. This action can be played as an interrupt.
cards.flavor: After years of training, the Druid becomes the one with nature, drawing power from the land and returning it when needed.

rulings.text: The land is untapped as a normal ability that goes on the stack. It is not a mana ability, so it can't be used at times that only mana abilities can be used.

cards.name: Library of Leng
cards.text:
You have no maximum hand size.

If an effect causes you to discard a card, discard it, but you may put it on top of your library instead of into your graveyard.
cards.originalText: There is no limit to size of your hand. If a card forces you to discard, you may choose to discard to top of your library rather than to graveyard. If discard is random, you may look at card before deciding where to discard it.

rulings.text: This effect has no effect on the cards being put into the graveyard from a library, because they are not "discarded".
You can't use the Library of Leng ability to place a discarded card on top of your library when you discard a card as a cost, because costs aren't effects.
The discard triggers anything else that triggers on discards.
You can look at a randomly discarded card before deciding where it goes.

The ability applies any time a spell or ability has you discard as part of its effect. It does not matter if you or your opponent control the spell or ability. The discard is forced because it is an effect.

If more than one card is discarded due to a single effect, the Library allows you to decide whether or not to use it on each of the cards. You get to decide the order the cards are placed on the library if more than one goes there.
Since the card goes directly to the library, the card is not revealed unless the spell or ability requiring the discard specifically says it is.
The ability replaces the normal discard action with a discard action that puts the card on the library instead of the graveyard.

If multiple effects modify your hand size, apply them in timestamp order. For example, if you put Null Profusion (an enchantment that says your maximum hand size is two) onto the battlefield and then put Library of Leng onto the battlefield, you'll have no maximum hand size. However, if those permanents entered the battlefield in the opposite order, your maximum hand size would be two.

cards.name: Lich
cards.text:
As Lich enters the battlefield, you lose life equal to your life total.

You don't lose the game for having 0 or less life.

If you would gain life, draw that many cards instead.

Whenever you're dealt damage, sacrifice that many nontoken permanents. If you can't, you lose the game.

When Lich is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, you lose the game.
cards.originalText: You lose all life. If you gain life later in the game, instead draw one card from your library for each life. For each point of damage you suffer, you must destroy one of your cards in play. Creatures destroyed in this way cannot be regenerated. You lose if this enchantment is destroyed or if you suffer a point of damage without sending a card to the graveyard.

rulings.text: If you have multiple Lich cards on the battlefield, you must sacrifice a permanent for each damage done to you for each Lich. This is because the sacrifice is a triggered ability. But you only draw one card for each life gained regardless of how many Liches you have. This is because the draw is a replacement effect and not a triggered one. You lose if any one of the Liches leaves the battlefield.
If you take more than one damage at a time, sacrifice the permanents for that damage simultaneously. This allows you to sacrifice both a creature and any Aura that is on it all at once.
You can't pay life, just like any player at less than one life can't pay life. You can pay zero life if you want.

If an opponent steals control of Lich and no other effect prevents you from losing with a life total of zero, you will lose the game due to a zero life total as a State-Based Action before you can take any actions.
